actor_awards.notes: A prolific character actor, playwright, and screenwriter known for his sharp-tongued, world-weary New York persona. He was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor for his role as Max Corkle in 'Here Comes Mr. Jordan'.

filmography.title: Here Comes Mr. Jordan
filmography.role_description: The bewildered boxing manager of a fighter who is taken to heaven too soon and returns in a new body.
filmography.plot: A boxer, mistakenly taken to Heaven before his time, is given a second chance back on Earth.

filmography.title: The Night of the Hunter
filmography.role_description: An old, alcoholic riverboat captain who befriends the children fleeing from a murderous preacher.
filmography.plot: A religious fanatic marries a gullible widow whose young children are reluctant to tell him where their real daddy hid the $10,000 he'd stolen.

filmography.title: Arsenic and Old Lace
filmography.role_description: A tough, loud-mouthed police lieutenant who investigates the Brewster household.
filmography.plot: A drama critic learns on his wedding day that his beloved maiden aunts are homicidal maniacs, and that insanity runs in his family.

filmography.title: Meet John Doe
filmography.role_description: The cynical, hard-drinking editor of a newspaper who tries to expose a political fraud.
filmography.plot: A man needing money agrees to impersonate a nonexistent person who said he'd be committing suicide as a protest, and a political movement begins.

filmography.title: A Tree Grows in Brooklyn
filmography.role_description: A kind-hearted saloon owner who befriends the alcoholic father of the Nolan family.
filmography.plot: A young girl comes of age in a Brooklyn tenement during the early 1900s, dealing with poverty and a beloved but alcoholic father.

filmography.title: The Bishop's Wife
filmography.role_description: A sympathetic taxi driver who becomes involved in the bishop's story.
filmography.plot: An angel in human form enters the life of a bishop in order to help him build a new cathedral and repair his fractured marriage.

filmography.title: The Clock
filmography.role_description: A friendly milk cart driver who helps a soldier and a girl during their whirlwind romance in New York.
filmography.plot: A soldier on leave in New York meets a girl and they fall in love and get married, all within twenty-four hours.

filmography.title: Suddenly
filmography.role_description: A retired Secret Service agent whose home is commandeered by assassins targeting the President.
filmography.plot: Three gangsters trap a family in their house on a hill overlooking a railroad station, planning to assassinate the President as he passes by.

filmography.title: A Guy Named Joe
filmography.role_description: The commanding officer and friend of a reckless pilot who dies and returns as a guardian angel.
filmography.plot: A dead pilot returns as a guardian angel to a new pilot who is falling in love with his old girlfriend.

filmography.title: The Last Hurrah
filmography.role_description: The loyal campaign manager and old friend of an aging mayor running for re-election.
filmography.plot: An aging mayor runs for re-election for the last time, facing a formidable opponent and changing times.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Win – Best Actor (Spencer Tracy)

filmography.title: Loving You
filmography.role_description: A press agent who helps discover a young singer played by Elvis Presley.
filmography.plot: A small-town delivery boy is discovered by a publicist and a country singer, who turn him into a rock and roll sensation.

filmography.title: The Penguin Pool Murder
filmography.role_description: A police inspector who reluctantly teams up with a schoolteacher to solve a murder in an aquarium.
filmography.plot: A schoolteacher and a police inspector investigate a murder at the New York Aquarium.

filmography.title: Murder on the Blackboard
filmography.role_description: Gleason reprises his role as the police inspector investigating a murder at a school.
filmography.plot: A schoolteacher investigates the murder of a music teacher found dead in the school cloakroom.

filmography.title: Murder on a Honeymoon
filmography.role_description: The third film in the Hildegarde Withers series featuring Gleason as Inspector Piper.
filmography.plot: Schoolteacher Hildegarde Withers finds a body on a seaplane to Catalina and calls in Inspector Piper.

filmography.title: Tales of Manhattan
filmography.role_description: A shantytown dweller who finds a tailcoat filled with money, sparking a miracle for his community.
filmography.plot: A black tailcoat passes through the hands of various owners, affecting their lives in different ways.

filmography.title: Lady and Gent
filmography.role_description: The manager of a prizefighter who helps raise a young boy.
filmography.plot: A prizefighter and his nightclub singer girlfriend try to raise a young ward while running a grocery store.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Writing, Original Story

filmography.title: The Ex-Mrs. Bradford
filmography.role_description: A police inspector who is constantly annoyed by the amateur sleuthing of a doctor and his ex-wife.
filmography.plot: A doctor is dragged into a murder investigation by his crime-novelist ex-wife.

filmography.title: Babes on Broadway
filmography.role_description: A sympathetic theatrical producer who helps a group of young hopefuls.
filmography.plot: A group of young performers put on a show to raise money for a settlement house.

filmography.title: Crash Dive
filmography.role_description: A submarine crew chief in this Technicolor war drama.
filmography.plot: A submarine lieutenant and his commander fall in love with the same woman against the backdrop of WWII.

filmography.title: Keys of the Kingdom
filmography.role_description: A Methodist missionary doctor who befriends a Catholic priest in China.
filmography.plot: A Scottish priest establishes a mission in China and endures decades of hardship, war, and personal loss.

filmography.title: Tycoon
filmography.role_description: A construction engineer working on a difficult railroad project in the Andes.
filmography.plot: An American engineer builds a railroad tunnel through the Andes for a powerful tycoon, courting his daughter in the process.

filmography.title: The Life of Riley
filmography.role_description: The neighbor and best friend of the bumbling Chester A. Riley.
filmography.plot: A factory worker struggles to get a promotion and deal with his daughter's romance.

filmography.title: Key to the City
filmography.role_description: A police sergeant who gets involved in the romantic escapades of two mayors.
filmography.plot: Two mayors meet at a convention in San Francisco and fall in love despite their political differences.

filmography.title: Come Fill the Cup
filmography.role_description: An ex-alcoholic who helps a newspaper editor get sober and help another young man.
filmography.plot: A recovering alcoholic reporter tries to help a young man who has fallen into the same trap.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor (Gig Young)

filmography.title: What Price Glory
filmography.role_description: A commanding officer in this remake of the WWI classic.
filmography.plot: Two professional soldiers in France during World War I fight over the same woman.

filmography.title: Down to Earth
filmography.role_description: Gleason reprises his Oscar-nominated role as the theatrical agent Max Corkle in this musical sequel.
filmography.plot: The muse Terpsichore comes to Earth to help a Broadway producer create a play about Greek mythology.
